meanings.sent1: She was criticized for being infrugal with her money.
meanings.sent2: He regretted his infrugal habits when he realized he had no savings.
meanings.sent3: The infrugal shopper bought items she didn't need just because they were on sale.
meanings.sent4: Her infrugal ways left her with an empty wallet and a closet full of unused items.
meanings.sent5: Being infrugal led to financial difficulties for the young couple.

meanings.sent1: The infrugal millionaire spent money on unnecessary luxuries.
meanings.sent2: Her infrugal lifestyle led to constant debt and financial stress.
meanings.sent3: Despite his limited income, he was infrugal in his spending on designer clothes.
meanings.sent4: The infrugal party planner went over budget on unnecessary decorations.
meanings.sent5: Their infrugal ways with money eventually caught up to them.

meanings.definition: Not economical or prudent in managing resources.
meanings.sent1: The infrugal manager's decisions led to unnecessary waste in the company.
meanings.sent2: She realized her infrugal approach to energy usage was costing her more in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The infrugal chef threw away perfectly good ingredients instead of using them creatively.
meanings.sent4: His infrugal mindset towards time management caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: Being infrugal with time often results in missed opportunities.
